intro: Parosela minor, commonly known as the lesser parosela, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors and rocky crevices. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are white or pale pink. Parosela minor is often found in alpine and subalpine environments, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions.
